sub_title: Sr Product Manager for Combination Product Operations Digital Thread at Amgen
summary:
I am a Product Development & Lifecycle Management specialist and Certified Scrum Product Owner®, obsessed with seamlessly integrating User Needs, Technological capabilities and Strategic planning to enable enterprises to consistently develop uniquely insightful & innovative products that improve users' quality of life.

My expertise is based on the background of multiple Graduate degrees in Product Design and Mechanical Engineering, and 10+ years work experience in Technical, Project Managerial and Strategic Planning roles in Product Development & Commercial Advancement in organizations of varied shapes, sizes, and industries across 3 continents.

Core competencies:
1) User-centered Design: Develop deep insights on delivering meaningful product-user interaction for improved Quality of Life of End users.
2) Analytical Problem Solving: Apply Structured Creativity for problem definition, analysis & creation of solutions space.
3) Strategic Planning: Maximize value for all stakeholders through application of Systems approach & Design thinking to New Product Development processes

Personality traits:
• Exceptionally Quick learner
• Keen analytical & problem-solving capabilities
• Strong communication and interpersonal skills
• Master of the "Adjacent Possible" - connecting dots across myriad domains to drive innovation

projects.title: A Helping hand for e-NABLE: Multi-material 3D printing applications for Ultimaker
projects.description:
Role: Graduation Intern
Company: Ultimaker B.V.
Program: Graduation Thesis, TU Delft

Based on extensive material testing, and research into bio-mechanics of human hand, usability of low-cost prostheses, Ultimaker business strategy and technology assessment, a novel functionally anthropomorphic prosthetic hand design "Ex_Machina" with improved dexterity and ease-of-assembly, was developed for the e-NABLE online platform (global community for open source 3D printed prostheses for people with upper limb deficiencies), to help improve quality of life of users.

This Master's graduation project received a top grade of 9/10 and led to awarding of Cum Laude distinction.

projects.description:
Role: Student Design Strategist
Company: Vive Innovation
Program: ID4045 Joint Master Project, TU Delft

Designed & prototyped a novel pencil ‘Roop’ & DIY pencil-making kit, using Wootex, a unique recycled Textile Plastic Composite (TPC) developed by Vive Innovation, with a Material-Driven Design approach. Created Strategic business roadmap & Product development plan for Vive's Product Portfolio based on strategic requirements and technical capabilities.

• Development of business roadmap and design strategy to achieve transition for Vive from low-level wood-substitute material supplier to large-scale market leader in composites via ingredient marketing.
• Developing material-driven design strategy to aid design team with development of product/s using Wootex (leading to design & prototyping of demonstrator 'ROOP- DIY pencil and pencil-making kit')

projects.title: "Gazelle Equilibrium" Bicycle Stabilization Proof-of-Concept Module - Embodiment Design for Royal Dutch Gazelle
projects.description:
Role: Student Design Engineer
Company: Koninklijke Gazelle N.V.
Program: ID4175 Advanced Embodiment Design, TU Delft

Developed a Proof-of-Concept Bike Stabilization Module for the Gazelle Orange C7+ Electric bike towards Gazelle's program of introducing bike stabilization technology for elderly riders via its range of e-bikes. Product Embodiment Design was based on the bike stabilization system (mechanical and control system) developed by Prof. Arend Schwab (Bicycle Dynamics Group, TU Delft) with the goal of development a stabilization module that met Gazelle's form, weight, ergonomics and cost requirements.

Key deliverables:
• Leading project team for commercialization of bike stabilization technology developed at TU Delft through design and testing of a Stabilization module for Gazelle C7+ Orange e-bike for elderly riders
• Project planning & Management of subsystem teams for handling electronics, controls, mechanics and form functions respectively. 
• Application of Systems approach for product integration with cross-functional team Scrums and daily work management.
• Design of electronics module and implementation of control algorithm

projects.title: "SleepSmart" Smart pillow for infants - Concept Design for Philips AVENT Smart Parenting Project
projects.description:
Role: Student Concept Designer
Company: Philips Avent
Program: ID 4170 Advanced Concept Design, TU Delft

Key deliverables:
• Exploration of Smart parenting solutions for the next generation of smart product-service systems for Philips Avent for 'Vision 2020'
• Research into role of culture, ergonomics, technology in parenting in various markets
• Development of product concept 'SleepSmart' in the area of Big data analytics and cyber-physical systems to reduce anxiety for first-time parents

SleepSmart is a smart pillow for infants, to help first-time parents with time management and planning in the crucial first few months when baby care can be unpredictable. SleepSmart uses predictive diagnostics to monitor and anlayse sleep activity of the baby and provides parents with sleep data of their child, along with sleep schedule prediction and customizable alerts & notifications.

projects.title: Feasibility of Additive Manufacturing method for developing Stretchable and Flexible Embedded Electronics
projects.description:
Masters' Thesis
Advisor: Dr. Tim Kowalewski

This work involves the development and testing of stretchable and flexible embedded circuits using additive manufacturing method. With the widespread popularity of desktop 3D printers the power of low-cost 3D printing can be harnessed to print electronics on stretchable and flexible bio-compatible skins with integrated circuitry, which can conform to irregularly shaped mounting surfaces. A multi-material freeform fabrication process with quick tool change provides the potential to print complete functional devices in a single manufacturing process, integrating the printing of both the structural and electronic blocks of the device. In this work, a custom-developed syringe-based controlled extrusion process using conductive silicone was developed for printing integrated circuits. The characteristics of the conductive silicone under stretching were studied. A proof-of-concept flexible bio-compatible skin device with an embedded voltage divider circuit was printed and the behavior of the device was studied under various working conditions.

contributors.headline: Sr Product Manager for Combination Product Operations Digital Thread at Amgen

projects.title: Virtual Pedal
projects.description:
Class Project (ME8243: Designing Smart Products) (Spring 2014)
Advisor: Prof. William K. Durfee, University of Minnesota

For video game users who seek a novel wireless, easy-to-use and unobtrusive foot-based human interface method the virtual pedal Is a wearable ankle sensor that measures & tracks the flexion and extension motions of the ankle joint for motion-based control of video games. 
 
The primary target market for the Virtual Pedal is the casual video gamer looking to enhance gameplay with inexpensive and easy-to-use controllers. However this device also has potential applications in secondary markets like fitness & athlete training, for physiotherapy & rehabilitation and for pedal based processors for musical instruments. Virtual Pedal can be used either in Analog input mode or for stepped/discrete inputs, as either a primary or auxiliary input device.

projects.title: Real-time Tissue Differentiation using Fiber Optic Sensing in Laser Catheters
projects.description:
Investigated the use of optical tissue characterisation to provide real-time feedback to infer imminent conditions  that cause adverse events and thus provide sufficient warning/advanced feedback to physicians to avoid errors in transvenous lead extraction and coronary vascular applications. Preliminary experiments were conducted to determine the feasibility of using reflected light from the optical fibers embedded in a laser sheath typical of lead extraction procedures for tissue identification at tool tip in real-time.
 
Using fiber-optic sensing techniques, a new "SmartLight" laser sheath being developed to aid the physician in "seeing" the tissue through optical tissue characterization and provide currently unavailable tissue information at tool tip for operative decision making.

projects.title: Blind spot assistance - The Human Factors approach
projects.description:
Class Project (ME 5211: Human Factors & Work analysis) (Fall 2012)
Advisor: Dr. Kathleen Harder, University of Minnesota
 
This project aimed at developing a solution to provide blind spot assistance systems for improving driving safety through advanced relay of necessary information to the user which is cognitively distinctive and clear in its implication. 
 
Our system proposed a Time-to-collision (TTC) based approach, utilizing the information gathered from peripheral sensors on the car to measure speed and distance of adjacent cars dynamically and map the TTC. In sync with calculated TTC, a simple color coded LED display system relays info to help the driver in decision making regarding lane change.
 
Testing of this sytem was done at the HumanFIRST simulation lab. Results showed that our proposed system for blindspot assistance improved driver comfort and reduced mental workload and effort  (See images for more details of the simulator and NASA-TLX index results)

projects.title: All-India White Space study & Market research initiative
projects.description:
The White space study was launched by my NPI team at Tata Motors in collaboration with VML Qais consulting (Singapore). The aim of the project was to complete a pan-India study of the automotive market through qualitative and quantitative studies and analysing the data to identify key opportunity spaces for new product development. I acted in the capacity of a Market research coordinator from NPI, to assist and plan implementation of the study.
 
For Phase 1 (Qualitative), I co-conducted the customer direct interviews for Bangalore region. For Phase 2 (Quantitative), I assisted in the development of the quantitative survey, coordinated the logistics for participation of Tata Motors' personnel (from various departments - marketing, R&D, Manufacturing, Technical services, Industrial Design, etc.) and worked on data assimilation and analysis. I also undertook the technical briefing for VML Qais for Phase 2.

projects.title: X4 Interiors Design Scheme
projects.description:
This design was developed as a culmination of a detailed consumer research and market benchmarking to identify key features and design concepts for a compact car for the Indian market. 
 
An initial Kano survey was conducted to determine key features (qualitative studies were conducted to identify stated and latent user needs) for the dashboard and interiors. Different combinations of features was tested to determine the right mix within the space and cost constraints.
 
A few sketches, each focusing on different attributes (feature-laden/ youthful & peppy/ futuristic look,etc.) were made. The feature-oriented concept interiors was considered for further detailing in line with the project attributes as well as consumer feedback.

projects.title: Delmia Simulation & Integration of powertrains in chassis marriage system
projects.description:
Trainee Project (Mar-June 2011),  Advisor: Mr. S.D.Pimpale
Technical Services (TCF), Tata Motors Car Plant, Pune
 
​​In this project under the Manufacturing planning division, I worked on modification of chassis marriage system (CMS) used for integration of powertrains with assembled chassis in the vehicle assembly shop. New tooling designs were developed for the CMS AGVs to be able to house the new powertrains, focusing on minimising process time & improving flexiblity of the CMS by utilizing common fixtures for multiple powertrains. A new concept for locating the powertrains was developed using flexible pin locators as engine mounting PLPs (position locating points) for the fixture table, which can be used in various configurations depending on the powertrain-chassis cobination being assembled. An ergonomics study was also done to assess process feasibility and operator ergonomics.

projects.title: Modeling and analysis of diffuser-nozzle in valveless micropumps
projects.description:
Undergraduate Thesis (Aug 09 - May 2010)
National Institute of Technology-Karnataka
Advisor: Dr. S.M.Kulkarni
 
Flow through valveless micropumps was studied and key diffuser/nozzle parameters affecting the micropump performance were identified from the micropump governing equation. A model was built for Finite Volume Method analysis. We carried out a parametric study to evaluate the nozzle geometric parameters for optimum micropump performance.
 
Using CFD analyses different geometric configurations of the nozzle elements were evaluated & using DFM principles, an optimum nozzle design selected. Commercial packages Ansys ICEM CFD and Fluent were used for the meshing and solving respectively.

projects.title: Saviteja
projects.description:
This project was carried as part of the course ME 411 - Integrated Product Design & Prototyping (NITK). Saviteja is a portable multifunctional rechargeable solar lamp that makes use of innovative thermoelectric technology. This product provides a sustainable lighting alternative aimed at rural regions in developing countries, where there is a scarcity of conventional sourcs of energy, even though most houshold appliances run on such sources (namely electricity). 

Saviteja was developed with a focus on making non-conventional energy solutions viable to the common man. From the needs hierarchy generated from the market research, 3 important areas were identified for design requirements, namely: 1. ergonomics - the ergonomic operation is a primary concern of users; 2. durability - since the lamp often faces tough situations,it needs to be not only rugged, but also be reliable; 3. multi-functionality - the lamp needs to cater to all the requirements of the household, varied as they are.

contributors.headline: Sr Product Manager for Combination Product Operations Digital Thread at Amgen

projects.title: Design & Analysis of UAV Wing using CFD for Defence R&D Organization (DRDO), Govt. of India
projects.description:
Role: Research Intern
Company: Aeronautical Development Establishment (ADE), Defence R&D Organization (DRDO), Govt. of India
Advisors: A.Vadivelan & Dr. Lurdharaj
 
This project dealt with the parametric study of the Lakshya wing with NACA64A008 aerofoil. Initially low fidelity parametric study was carried out with Digital DATCOM to assess the relative effect of various wing planform parameters on the aerodynamic performance.
 
The wing planform was varied by varying a design parameter, while keeping other parameters constant. Of the initial 4 parameters considered, based on the initial study 2 cases were considered for the design of the wing planform, and then high fidelity parametric studies were carried out with Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD). Using ANSYS ICEM CFD for meshing and FLUENT for solving, the aerodynamic parameters were estimated and an optimized planform chosen.

profile_positions.title: Sr Digital Product Manager

profile_positions.description:
Manager of the Digital Strategy & Capabilities team within Amgen's Medical Devices business unit ('Combination Product Operations' aka CPO). Responsible for the definition and build of next-gen Enterprise software to support the digital transformation of CPO's End-to-End Product Development and Commercialization processes. Focused primarily on managing the Project Portfolio Management (PPM) and Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) products.
Job Responsibilities:
• Manage Digital team serving CPO
• Undertake Digital Innovation Strategic planning 
• Own Product definition, build and delivery
• Support Change Management within CPO
----------------------------------------------

// Manage Digital Team
• Manager of Digital Development Services team comprising of  Scrum Master, UX researcher, Business Analysts and Technology Specialists who service the CPO organization on key projects throughout the various stages of digital transformation.
• Manage a team of Digital Product Leads who are embedded within impacted CPO business groups and support digitalization of their respective business processes and change management.

// Digital Innovation Strategic planning
• Define process architecture for CPO functions and identify key transformation areas
• Collaborate with engineers and architects across several enterprise organizations from Amgen's multiple verticals to determine strategic fit with software city planning and ongoing objectives
• Develop Digitalization strategy for CPO and process business cases through organizational digital programs pipeline

// Product Definition, Build & Delivery
• Work with stakeholders and identify user needs for target business process and document requirements
• As Certified Scrum Product Owner, own build, testing and roll-out for PLM and PPM platforms

// Change Management Support
• Support Digital Product Leads towards change management with target business groups
• Support digital literacy & continuous improvement efforts

• Assist Course coordinator, Prof. Barry Kudrowitz in syllabus implementation and course planning
• Grading student work and providing feedback
• Organizing "Playsentations", the finale of Toy Product Design, a public presentation of the final student toy concepts in the form a theatrical production.

profile_positions.description:
Cross-functional Product development team lead within the Passenger Vehicle NPI (New Product Introduction) Group focused on early phase product Definition & Feasibility and Lifecycle Management  for new products within the mid-range passenger vehicle market.
Primary responsibilities:
• Early Product definition support (Market Research/ Industrial design)
• Technical Project Management for NPI projects
• NPI business process analysis and refinement
• Continuous improvement for Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) platform

Previously was part of 1 year rotational program executing projects in Sales & Marketing (3.5 months), Vehicle Assembly Shop (4 months), Manufacturing Planning (Veh. Assy.) (3.5 months) and Supplier Quality Management (1 month)

volunteer_experiences.description:
Vidyadhanam is the eduaction outreach program of the CSR wing of Tata Motors, Pune. The aim of the program is to support meritorious students in govt. schools, from low-income rural families, to ensure their continued education and welfare.
 
As a volunteer, I, along with a team of colleagues, visited remote locations of western Maharashtra to meet with shortlisted students, their teachers and their families. We visited their schools and talked in detail about the opportunities for development with the coninued Tata group support for academically brilliant students, both financially and vocationally.

• SPARSH is an initiative by the students of NITK which aims to develop rural regions by linking them with teams of NGOs and sponsors to realize and economically feasible and sustainable idea. Sparsh was launched during ENGINEER - Golden Jubilee Edition (2009-10).
• Team Sparsh worked alongside the faculty of NITK and Gajini Foundation, a local NGO. 
• Students worked on utilizing engineering skills to help in economic empowerment and improvement of village infrastructure and living conditions through the use of technology and innovation. (Region: coastal village of Munda [9 km from NITK] )

Youtube link: http://youtu.be/qlRDLe3dLKM
